column1: The Pasir Mas railway station is a Malaysian railway station located at and named after the town of Pasir Mas
column2: Kelantan. It is also the starting interchange of the disused Rantau Panjang Line. A new railway station which replaced the original railway station was completed in July 2008.

column1: From Pasir Mas there is a railway straight to Kuala Lumpur. The railway starts from Gemas. From Pasir Mas
column2: there are several small stations en route like Temangan
column3: Tok Uban and many more. This railway also connects to Kuala Kerai Station
column4: one of the largest stations in Kelantan. A small station near this area is named Jerek. This station is also mostly used as a commerce hub for the city area.
